poem.title: Freedom Fries
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: He played cricket, my dad. You can whack Fours and sixes, but fives are a slog, What with fires invading the pitch. And then poems are on-the-spot fines; They take time - and for what? Wee phials Or files of sound, sense and shape: Nothing for staingramdotcom, Nothing that finds a solution. The smoke? It chases the flies from your double Beefburger and chips.
